definition: to fulfill (one's obligations)/to carry out (a task)/to implement (an agreement)/to perform
shoe/to tread on
row/line/commercial firm/line of business/profession/to rank (first, second etc) among one's siblings (by age)/(in data tables) row/(Tw) column

to walk/to go/to travel/a visit/temporary/makeshift/current/in circulation/to do/to perform/capable/competent/effective/all right/OK!/will do/behavior/conduct/Taiwan pr. [xing4] for the behavior-conduct sense

sentences.english: It must not express that the drawee will perform his promise by any other means than the payment of money.
sentences.chinese: 不得書明付款人將用付款以外之方法履行承諾。

sentences.english: Remember to carry out your promise.
Every monitor must carry out the invigilating responsibilities.
sentences.chinese: 每個監考員必須履行監考職責。

sentences.english: Chinese leaders that Russia will fulfil the Sino-Russian border agreement faithfully.
sentences.chinese: 中國領導人說，俄羅斯將履行中俄邊界協議的回信。

sentences.english: It is a charge to keep and I will give it my all.
sentences.chinese: 它是一項要履行的職責，我將爲此鞠躬盡瘁。

sentences.english: Last, the author discusses the relationship between judgment for conductingagain and judgment for performance.
sentences.chinese: 最後，本文對重作判決和履行判決的關係進行了梳理。

sentences.english: They had carried out their robbery with swords, blades and pistols.
sentences.chinese: 他們已經履行了其與劍，刀和手槍搶劫。

sentences.english: Perform any operational duties for the organization or its affiliates.
sentences.chinese: 代組織或其機構履行運營職責。

sentences.english: Since women cannot perform the duties of ancestor worship, girl children are often murdered by their parents.
sentences.chinese: 女人不能履行祭祖的職責，所以女嬰常常被父母弄死。

sentences.english: Are you worrying about the non-execution of the contract and non-payment on our part?
sentences.chinese: 你可否憂鬱我們不履行合同或者拒不付款？

sentences.english: The princess refused to keep her promise to the frog.
sentences.chinese: 公主拿到玩具後拒不履行之前給青蛙的承諾。

sentences.english: The pertinent self-disciplinary organizations shall conduct self-disciplinary administration on the introduction business in pursuance of the law.
sentences.chinese: 相關自律性構造依法對介紹營業勾當履行自律管理。

sentences.english: Proposals are the major carriers for the CPPCC to perform its basic roles.
sentences.chinese: 提案是人民政協履行基本職能的主要載體。

sentences.english: This king was a good man, who took his responsibilities as ruler seriously.
sentences.chinese: 這位國王是位明君，認真地履行他統治者的責任。

sentences.english: Kyrgyzstan will implement all the agreements and treaties that have been reached with China.
sentences.chinese: 吉方將會履行同中方簽署的所有協議協定。

sentences.english: To apply for a travel permit, what procedures shall be completed?
sentences.chinese: 申請旅行證須履行下列哪些手續？

definition: duty/obligation/CL:項|项[xiang4]/volunteer (work etc)
to promise/to undertake to do something/commitment
to keep a promise/to honor an agreement
to exercise (a right etc)

to agree on sth (after discussion)/to conclude a bargain/to arrange/to promise/to stipulate/to make an appointment/stipulated (time, amount, quality etc)/an arrangement/a deal/appointment/undertaking/commitment/understanding/engagement/stipulation
on schedule/on time
to be responsible for
to fulfill (one's duty etc)
duty/responsibility/obligation
to take effect/to go into effect
according to the law
to agree to and sign (a treaty etc)
to repay a debt in full/to redeem/to clear
to conclude (treaty, contract, agreement etc)/to set up (a rule etc)
to comply with/to abide by/to respect (an agreement)
to undertake/to assume (responsibility etc)
